Description: When a device activates and moisture is already high or rises soon after, the alert corresponds to a real wet event; activations with flat moisture indicate false or test alerts.
short rationale: Activation + moisture correlation validates events; moderate incident specificity.

Description: If moisture rises above a defined threshold and stays elevated but no device activation occurs nearby in time, that wet event was not alerted.
short rationale: Exposes unalerted wet incidents with timing; higher reconstruction risk.

Description: Frequent device activations accompanied only by tiny, short-lived moisture blips or none at all indicate overly sensitive alert rules.
short rationale: Highlights noisy activations; low privacy impact.

Description: After a device indicates resolution, moisture returning to baseline confirms that the incident is physically resolved.
short rationale: Resolution check; limited sensitivity.

Description: The time from first device activation or resolution status to moisture dropping back below baseline is the drying time after intervention.
short rationale: Recovery timing per incident; moderate exposure.

Description: Device activations that coincide with high peak moisture and long elevated moisture durations indicate more severe incidents than those with small, brief moisture changes.
short rationale: Severity prioritization per event; detailed but technical.

Description: Comparing moisture levels in events that did trigger device activations versus those that did not reveals the effective moisture threshold currently in use.
short rationale: Threshold tuning using outcomes; moderate incident detail.

Description: Locations where moisture slowly rises and stays elevated for long periods without any device activation indicate chronic dampness that is not being alerted.
short rationale: Reveals unalerted dampness by location; notable location sensitivity.

Description: Comparing the time of first device activation to the time of maximum moisture level for each incident shows whether action was early or late relative to the wetness peak.
short rationale: Mitigation timing per incident; moderate exposure.

Inference: Comparing devices by moisture reduction impact
Description: For incidents where different devices activate, comparing moisture decay rates after each activation shows which devices reduce dampness fastest.
short rationale: Device effectiveness comparison; moderate incident detail.

Description: Devices that activate on a regular schedule while moisture remains flat can be tagged as test or self-check routines.
short rationale: Identifies routine tests; low privacy impact.

Description: When moisture remains high after initial activation but starts falling quickly after escalated activations, escalation is effective.
short rationale: Evaluates escalation per incident; moderate sensitivity.

Description: If moisture stays above baseline for a long time after all related devices deactivate, there is residual dampness that outlives the reported resolution.
short rationale: Post-incident persistence; moderate timeline exposure.

Description: Repeated activations in the same zone with similar or increasing moisture profiles suggest users are acknowledging or silencing alerts without fully fixing or drying the area.
short rationale: Indicates user behavior/patterns; higher privacy sensitivity.

Description: If a sensor repeatedly logs significant moisture peaks in a zone where no devices ever activate, that zone is monitored but not protected.
short rationale: Highlights protection gaps by zone; location-sensitive.

Description: Device activations that typically occur just before moisture begins to rise are proactive, while those that consistently trail moisture spikes are reactive.
short rationale: Response classification using timing; moderate sensitivity.

Description: When a pump or dehumidifier activates and moisture then trends downward, the device is effective; activation with flat or rising moisture suggests underperformance or failure.
short rationale: Performance check per incident; moderate exposure.

Description: A single activation followed by moisture rises at many sensors indicates a widespread damp incident, while activations accompanied by moisture change at only nearby sensors indicate a localized event.
short rationale: Scope classification; moderate location sensitivity.

Description: If moisture spikes at night typically see longer delays before device activation than similar spikes during the day, response is time-of-day dependent.
short rationale: Time-of-day patterns reveal presence/behavior; higher sensitivity.

Inference: Ranking zones by wet unmitigated time
Description: For each zone, summing periods where moisture is above threshold and no device is active yields wet-unmitigated time for that zone.
short rationale: Zone-level metric; location/history sensitive.

Description: If devices deactivate while moisture is still elevated or soon rises again, all clear was declared too early.
short rationale: Shows premature resolution with timelines; moderate exposure.

Inference: Distinguishing nuisance dampness vs. critical dampness
Description: Device activations tied to small, quickly resolving moisture peaks represent nuisance damp events, while those tied to high, long-lasting moisture plateaus represent critical damp events.
short rationale: Severity classification per event; moderate detail.

Inference: Trend-based classification: chronic vs. episodic damp
Description: Zones with rising baseline moisture and occasional small activations exhibit chronic environmental damp, while zones with sharp moisture spikes tightly coupled to occasional activations are episodic incident zones.
short rationale: Chronic vs. episodic mapping by zone; location/history sensitivity.

Inference: Policy gaps in high-risk damp zones
Description: If a zone frequently exhibits large or long moisture excursions yet device activations there are rare or delayed, policy is underreacting relative to risk.
short rationale: Shows under-response in specific zones; location-sensitive.

Description: Over time, the system can compare moisture patterns that historically led to helpful device activations versus those that did not, and refine activation rules accordingly.
short rationale: Rule tuning from history; moderate incident detail.
